content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">Raven’s Dox2 Quick Guide</>
content.text:
<TextStyle.Orange>Survivor, welcome to your next evolution.</>

You’ve joined the Official Dox2 server network, where only the boldest prevail! Experience the ruthless, challenging DOX2 overhaul where every victory is hard-earned, and every setback is a chance to adapt and overcome.

<TextStyle.Green>DOX2 OfficialServers:</>

<RichColor Color="1,0,1,1">Dino Overhaul X 2 - Official Valguero (Medium Difficulty)</>



==============================================

content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">Guide Index</>
content.text:
<RichColor Color="1,0.82,0.2,1">Join our Discord for help, guides, and more! https://discord.gg/YHWTcWBK</>

<RichColor Color="0,1,0,1">See a bug? make a report in the bug report forum</>

<RichColor Color="0.4,0.7,1,1">Need help? come to the helpdesk</>

content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">DOX2 Basics</>
content.text:
<TextStyle.Orange>Welcome to Dino Overhaul X 2!</>

DOX2 will test your skill, patience, and resolve. You’ll lose tames and gear, face setbacks, and sometimes get wiped by surprise. That’s normal, keep going and you’ll get stronger and overcome the odds!

<TextStyle.Green>First Things to Do:</>

Don’t rush to tame. Secure a safe base first—caves, cliffs, or hard-to-reach places are best.

<RichColor Color="1,0,0,1">Avoid power leveling</>! Leveling up too quickly can cause harder enemies and events to appear as they are level based.

Hunt small creatures for early Hunter XP and key resources.

Kill alpha creatures you can handle for genetic strings and loot.

Make your first major goal after securing a place to operate - the DOX Crafting Station and a few Hunter XP Storage Orbs.

Work on improving your <RichColor Color="1,1,0,1">five main sources</> of power: your mount, mount paragon level, pygmy, enhanced armor, and various crystals/potions.

<RichColor Color="0.20,0.55,1,1">Mount:</> Main combat partner—choose and breed wisely.

<RichColor Color="0.20,0.55,1,1">Paragon Level:</> Your creatures’s DOX2 combat level; raises DMG, DR, SPD for each level earned up to 10.

<RichColor Color="0.20,0.55,1,1">Pygmy:</> Shoulder pet that boosts your mounts Dox2 stats.

<RichColor Color="0.20,0.55,1,1">Enhanced Armor:</> Dox2 enhanced armors provide stat boosts for your player and mount, rider protection (requires a full set of same type armor), environment protection, and various special abilities.

<RichColor Color="0.20,0.55,1,1">Upgrades & Potions:</> Permanent upgrade crystals equipped to your hotbar, and consumable potions that give temporary buffs for added edge in difficult fights.

content.title: <RichColor Color="1,0.5,0,1">Taming And Hunter XP Explained</>
content.text:
DOX2 taming is <RichColor Color="1,0,1,1">hands-on!</> You can’t tranq and force feed like vanilla Ark taming.

DOX2 taming uses a combination of a unique resource called Hunter Xp which is gained from defeating foes, and either the passive hand-feeding method along with their favorite food equipped to the last spot of your hotbar, OR the “drop method” where you drop kibble or preferred food onto the ground within 20m.

Drop Taming is effective for aggressive or hard-to-approach creatures, but this method costs more Hunter XP and kibble (about 2-3x more) but is much faster and safer.

Some special creatures (Manticores, Dragons, Wyverns, Drakes, Golems etc.) have unique taming systems—check for special requirements.

Hunter Xp - you will see your Hunter Xp gauge at the bottom left of your hud, when you kill things it will increase the gauge.  The more challenging the opponent the more Xp you gain.  This XP is used to tame creatures, and to re-roll armor bonuses later in your progression.  If you die your hunter Xp will be lost.

content.title: <RichColor Color="1,0.5,0,1">Progression Tips</>
content.text:
Early game try to hunt down small alpha creatures like dodos and dilos.  Use the finder mod located on the map screen to scan for them and track them easily.  They can drop the genetic strings you need to progress.  Large alpha creatures can drop prime genetic strings for a big boost in survivability.

Empowered creatures can be killed to get the artifact fragments you need for progression.  Try to breed a few decent combat tames and get them traits in order to take on these early challenging foes.  


Empowered creatures will appear when the Overlord does a flyover, then despawn shortly after he leaves, so try to time your hunt accordingly.  


To avoid being forced to fight doppelgängers be sure to dismount your creatures when the Overlord does flyovers.

content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">Traits Explained</>
content.text:
<RichColor Color="1,1,0,1">Traits</>
Traits make your tames stronger, tougher, and faster. They’re essential for survival and a major focus of Dox2.

View traits: In your dino’s inventory, press “Show Buffs” to see all current traits, paragon level, and bonuses.

Traits can potentially come from taming, raising, fighting, and special consumables obtained through various methods including extracted from creatures.

Stack positive traits for huge boosts, each trait can potentially increases or decrease damage, reduction, or speed.

<RichColor Color="1,1,0,1">Trait Data & Breakdown</>
Wild Traits (W): Up to 3 per creature, randomly assigned at tame/maturation to adult.

Natural Traits (N): Up to 3, earned by killing or taking damage from worthy foes (equal/higher weight class).

Unique Wild (UW) & Unique Natural (U): These higher tier natural traits each  offer significant boosts. Earned only after a creature has earned 3 Natural traits

Prime (P) & Mega (M): These are the powerful traits available only to Alpha tier and up creatures, giving huge maximum health increases, and powerful stat boosts as well as some very special passive abilities. These traits can only be given to creatures manually via strings and only once a creature has earned a U trait and reached paragon level 4 for Prime and 7 for Mega. Note that pygmys cannot be given a P/M trait unless it does not already have any PP/PM traits.

Legendary Traits - Special endgame traits given only from defeating extremely powerful Primordial enemies.

content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">Trait Values</>
content.text:
<RichColor Color="1,1,0,1">Trait Values</>
(W) Traits

	•	(W) Tough: DMG +10, DR +10, SPEED -5

	•	(W) Balanced: DMG +7.5, DR +5, SPEED +5

	•	(W) Runner: DMG -5, DR +0, SPEED +15

	•	(W) Brawler: DMG +15, DR +2.5, SPEED -5
	
	•	(W) Fragile: DR -10

	•	(W) Weak: DMG -10

	•	(W) Paralyzed: DR -5, SPEED -10
	
⸻


(N) Traits

	•	(N) Tough: DMG +0, DR +15, SPEED -5

	•	(N) Balanced: DMG +5, DR +0, SPEED +5

	•	(N) Runner: DMG -5, DR +0, SPEED +10

	•	(N) Brawler: DMG +10, DR +5, SPEED -5
	
	•	(N) Fragile: DR -15
	
	•	(N) Weak: DR -15
	
	•	(N) Paralyzed: DR -5 SPEED -10


⸻


(A) Traits

	•	(A) Tough: DMG +0, DR +5, SPEED -2.5

	•	(A) Balanced: DMG +2.5, DR +0, SPEED +2.5

	•	(A) Runner: DMG +0, DR +0, SPEED +5

	•	(A) Brawler: DMG +5, DR +2.5, SPEED -2.5
	
	•	(A) Fragile: DR -7.5
	
	•	(A) Weak: DMG -7.5 
	
	•	(A) Paralyzed: DR -2.5 SPEED -5


⸻


(UW) Traits

	•	(UW) Tough: DMG +15, DR +7.5, SPEED -5

	•	(UW) Balanced: DMG +10, DR +5, SPEED +5

	•	(UW) Runner: DMG -5, DR +0, SPEED +15

	•	(UW) Juggernaut: DMG +12.5, DR +10, SPEED -2.5


⸻


(U) Traits

	•	(U) Tough: DMG +5, DR +15, SPEED -2.5

	•	(U) Balanced: DMG +10, DR +0, SPEED +10

	•	(U) Runner: DMG -5, DR +0, SPEED +15

	•	(U) Juggernaut: DMG +15, DR +10, SPEED -5


⸻


(P) Prime Traits +25% Maximum Health

	•	(P) Tough: DMG +15, DR +20, SPEED +0 

	•	(P) Balanced: DMG +20, DR +0, SPEED +5

	•	(P) Runner: DMG +0, DR +0, SPEED +25

	•	(P) Juggernaut: DMG +25, DR +15, SPEED -5


⸻


(M) Mega Traits +40% Maximum Health

	•	(M) Tough: DMG +15, DR +25, SPEED +0

	•	(M) Balanced: DMG +25, DR +0, SPEED +7.5

	•	(M) Runner*: DMG +0, DR +0, SPEED +15

	•	(M) Juggernaut: DMG +30, DR +20, SPEED -5
	
	
⸻


Legendary Traits
	
	•	(Alpha) DMG +50, DR -12.5, SPEED -12.5
	
	•	(Gamma) DMG +20, DR +20, SPEED -25
	
	•	(Omega) DMG +25, DR -20, SPEED +25

content.title: <RichColor Color="1,0.5,0,1">Pygmys</>
content.text:
Pygmys are an extremely important aspect of Dox2, they’re easily just as important as your mount and armor for tackling endgame foes.  


A Pygmys Trait % power is passed directly to the Mount when equipped to a player.   


Many pygmys have useful abilities and give buffs to the rider and Mount, some can help contribute to damage and even be a massive source of extra DPS in the case of summoners.  and some very special ones have incredible passive bonuses.  

So what is a Pygmy and how do you get one?  

Pygmys are miniature versions of Dox creatures that can be found in the wild, a small blue star over their heads, and a “! pygmy nearby” notification in the corner when in proximity. 


Pygmys have random rolled traits that include 2 special traits that only Pygmys can have.  Pygmy Prime and Pygmy Mega (PP/PM) traits are random rolled values based on the Pygmys drag weight.  So large Pygmys have a better chance to have higher value trait %, and Legacy and Primordial creatures will make much more powerful Pygmys in the late and endgame.  


<RichColor Color="0,1,1,1">Pygmys can be tamed using pygmy kibble</> in the last slot of your hotbar. Unlike normal Dox creatures, taming Pygmys with pygmy kibble does not require Hunter Xp, rather a random chance w each feeding (2 pygmy kibble is required per feeding) to instant tame the pygmy.  So a pygmy could take  2 pygmy kibble or it could take 20 pygmy kibble.  Simply stand next to a pygmy and it will take the kibble from your hotbar automatically and either SUCCEED or FAIL w a displayed notification alerting you.  


<RichColor Color="0,1,1,1">Alternatively Pygmys can also be created from any Dox creature by feeding it EVO kibble</>.  With several types of Evo kibble available to players, the odds of getting good Pygmys varies.  In the late - endgame serious players will be using high quality Evo kibble on Legacy and Primo creatures to have the best chance at quality Pygmys used for the final battles.  


Pygmy possible roll ranges - 

5% bonus to 20% for most creatures, and up to 35% for high drag weight, and finally up to a whopping 65% bonus possible on Primo pygmys.  Keep in mind 5% is always the minimum roll so a bad roll is still possible even on the highest tier of pygmys.

content.title: <RichColor Color="1,0.5,0,1">Primo Pygmy Passive Bonuses</>
content.text:
Primo Pygmy Bear - 10% DMG/DR
Primo Pygmy Doed - 5% DMG, 15% DR
Primo Pygmy Kong - 15% DMG, 5% DR
Primo Pygmy Manticore - 7.5% DMG/DR +50 HP per sec
Primo Pygmy Megapithicus - 20% DMG +25 HP per sec
Primo Pygmy Rex - 20% DR
Primo Pygmy Rhynio - 25% DMG, 5% DR
Primo Pygmy Ice Titan - 10% DMG, 5% DR, +20 HP and Stam per sec

content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">Enhanced Armor</>
content.text:
Enhanced Armor

Enhanced armor sets are your main protection and a massive power boost after early game - they boost damage, damage reduction, and movement speed on your mount, as well as providing your mount with some various abilties. 
While mixing and matching armor types provides small set bonuses per piece (at 2 and 3 pieces of one type equipped you receive set bonuses) it is recommended to equip a full set of one type of armor asap to gain the “Enhanced Armor Protection” and the “Environment Protection” buffs.

Enhanced Armor Protection buff - prevents your player from being killed off the back of your mount by boss types like Prime and Mega creatures, and special attacks such as breath attacks from Wyverns etc. 

Environment Protection buff - provides immunity to poison gas, and radiation as well as providing a massive boost to insulation against extreme heat and cold. 

Early game if you do not have a full set of enhanced armor and must battle boss type creatures, be sure to craft some Impenetrable Potions they can provide you these buffs for a short time if needed. 

Enhanced Armor can be looted from Seekers, Doppelgängers, bounties, golden dodos, Megas, Primordials and up. 

After early game it is possible to use the Summoning Shrine to reroll the random lines of stats on Enhanced Armor in exchange for Hunter Xp, make sure to try to do this for extra power when you can afford to.

content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">Potions & Temporary Buffs</>
content.text:
Potions & Temporary Buffs

Craft and use a dozen different Potions for temporary, but powerful effects as preperation for boss fights, or top-offs during encounters.  HP Regen Elixirs can be used from your hotbar and provide you or your mount with 10 seconds of powerful healing.  (Be aware there is a small cooldown between uses, so time wisely) 

Some rare genetic strings can also provide massive temporary buffs to combat stats when force-fed to your mount.

content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">DOX Crystals</>
content.text:
Crystals

Craft special Crystals for permanent passive buffs (put crystals on your hotbar to receive buffs)
Crystals are crafted from genetic materials, artifact fragments, corruption crystal shards, and warlord shards. 

Ingredients come from empowered and corrupted creatures, Megas, Mega champions, and global buffed creatures (extra xp, extra loot, juiced, infestation festers)
Collect all crystals for the best long-term power-up!

content.title: <RichColor Color="0.8,0.5,0.2,1">Frequently Asked Questions</>
content.text:
"Why can't I tame this dino?"
-Not enough hunter XP, maybe it is temporarily untamebale as it just killed something. Check the spyglass mod readout for clues"Purple" glow means it didn't like your offering. Check your buffs to see if your taming buff is red or green!

"Why am I dying so much?"
-DOX2 is tough by design! Stack up traits, armor, pygmys, and upgrades.

"How do I see my tame's stats and buffs?"
-Open your tame's inventory and use "Show Buffs."

"How do I progress early?"
-Build safe, kill small creatures for XP, don't rush tames, always prepare for setbacks, and focus on upgrading your power sources!
